message_1: What is the least positive integer "x" such that 3 raised to the power "x" is congruent to 7 (mod 17)?
message_2:
We are looking for the smallest positive integer x such that 3^x ≡ 7 (mod 17). We can start by testing different values of x and checking the congruence.

x = 1: 3^1 ≡ 3 (mod 17)
x = 2: 3^2 ≡ 9 (mod 17)
x = 3: 3^3 ≡ 27 ≡ 10 (mod 17)
x = 4: 3^4 ≡ 81 ≡ 13 (mod 17)
x = 5: 3^5 ≡ 243 ≡ 4 (mod 17)
x = 6: 3^6 ≡ 729 ≡ 12 (mod 17)
x = 7: 3^7 ≡ 2187 ≡ 2 (mod 17)
x = 8: 3^8 ≡ 6561 ≡ 6 (mod 17)
x = 9: 3^9 ≡ 19683 ≡ 18 ≡ 1 (mod 17)
x = 10: 3^10 ≡ 59049 ≡ 54 ≡ 7 (mod 17)

So, the least positive integer x such that 3^x is congruent to 7 (mod 17) is x = 10.
